text.tspan: Jake Marcus is the only child of a wealthy family. His father is a
businessman who owns and runs a multinational corporation with
manufacturing plants worldwide, and his mother is a sensitive
woman with a love for art.
Jake's family had long been wealthy in the military business.
Although Jake's father's generation had retired from the military,
the human and material resources accumulated over the years had
served his father's business and his family well, allowing Jake to
grow up in a more affluent and generous environment than most.
Even at such a young age, the brilliant speech and intelligence he had inherited from his parents
and the knowledge he had cultivated became an extraordinary charisma that drew everyone
around him to his side. It became his strength, building a force. It took less than a year
for the entirety of the refuge to follow his lead, and Jake led the organized refugees
in a raid on his family's former mob-occupied bunker, slaughtering them
all to avenge his father and mother.
Even after the war was over, it took some time for the ashes of death to clear from
the skies so that people couldn't return to the land immediately.
It wasn't until several years after the war, when the shelter's supplies
were nearly depleted, that Jake emerged, followed by his faithful servant,
Melphine, and his fellow evacuees, now fully converted to his cause.
Jake, who had come of age during his time in the bunker, led his followers
on a long trek to find a home on the surface.
It was a tough decision for those who had just emerged
from the shelter, but everyone decided to follow his lead.
When Jake was seven years old, war broke out. The global war was an inevitable
disaster for him and his family, but his family's wealth provided them a way to survive.
Jake's father took the family to a pre-designed and built underground bunker. Unlike a
typical shelter, this was a sturdy, secure bunker explicitly built for a limited number of
people. Jake and his family took refuge in the bunker with only a few trusted users,
thinking the war would end quickly.
